Case reference: 2016032179.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1944, Richard David was seen for the last time riding his bicycle in front of the family home while his brother was inside the house in Etobicoke, Ontario. Richard's bike was found at the house when his mother returned home that evening but Richard had vanished. He was a good child at home and in school, with no reason to run away.

Socks: Cotton, Grey, Yellow band at top

Case reference: 2020028767.CaseDesc: In the late evening of August 24, 1975, Jean-Marc Meagher was seen for the last time in Berthierville, Quebec.

Case reference: 2019071422.CaseDesc: On December 7, 2019, Kidist Mohamed was seen for the last time near Brant Street and King Street West in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2007005299.CaseDesc: Shelley Mathieu-Read resided in Sarnia, Ontario. She was last seen on May 20, 2007 in Sarnia but has not been heard from since. An extensive investigation by the Sarnia Police Service has failed to locate her.

Scar: Forehead, from hairline running down into forhead
Tattoo: Right Foot, graphic of a star

Case reference: 2013000128.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1990, Delphine Nikal was left in the care of her uncle. At approximately 2:00 pm Delphine advised her uncle she was going to meet her three girlfriends in Smithers BC (approx 16 km. away).  Delphine hitchhiked to Smithers and met up with her friends. At approximately 10:00 pm Delphine called her uncle to tell him that she was on her way home from Smithers. She was last seen by her two friends hitchhiking in the east bound lane of Hwy #16.

Jacket: Denim, Blue, Light bleached with white pocket sewn on inside, Levi's
Purse: Leather, Black, Pouch style containing hair spray, brush, pictures, make up, address book
Pants: Denim, Pink, Described as a hot pink and tight to the leg. Knee length

Case reference: 2016068946.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1972, the body of a male was found washed up on the shore of the Municipal Beach, in St. Catharines. It is believed that he had been in the water for only a few hours prior to discovery.

Case reference: 2014002370.CaseDesc: On June 16, 1997, at approximately 4:30 pm Kelvin Zdarski and two friends left Dauphin, Manitoba and headed for a cabin near Waterhen, Manitoba. Over the course of the evening there was an argument between the men. Kelvin left the cabin and never returned. The men looked for him on their way back to Dauphin and did not see him. A man matching Kelvin's description was seen walking on the road at 7:30 am on the 17th of June. An extensive search by land, air and water proved negative. Kelvin did not take his wallet, money or any identification to the cabin and had no means of transportation. Mr. Zdarski has not been seen or heard from again.

Scar: Left Calf, 1 inch long, back of calf

Case reference: 2014005768.CaseDesc: On March 16, 2012, Sol Han was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Sol did not show up for school.

Case reference: 2016055037.CaseDesc: Human remains were found on May 10, 2006 in a field near Mossleigh, AB. They are believed to be those of a female, over the age of 40, possibly of Caucasian or Aboriginal descent, who was between 5’2” and 5’6”. The individual was missing teeth and likely wore an upper denture. The individual may have complained of joint pain due to arthritis. The remains appear to have been there from 1 to 5 years

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Cheek, Healed fracture of right cheek bone
Mark: Right Side Of Head, Large button osteoma on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2014001590.CaseDesc: On May 1, 1990, Claude L'Heureux was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Claude had worked in bars in The Village district of Montreal, Quebec. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014002445.CaseDesc: On April 9, 1998, Elaine Dumba was reported missing from Coquitlam, British Columbia. However, Ms. Dumba’s family have not seen or heard from her since April 9, 1989.

Case reference: 2014006195.CaseDesc: On April 12, 2004, Randy Boudreau was last seen at his residence in Campbellton, New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2014030665.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1978, the partial remains of a female believed to be aged between 55-70 years of age, were found in the waters of the Salish Sea, southwest of Victoria, British Columbia. She had moderate arthritis and significant healed injuries to her left ankle and foot. It is believed she was deceased several months or even years before her remains were recovered

Case reference: 2014005770.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1979, Thomas Lidguerre and Lawrence Sanger headed out from Fond du Lac to Uranium City on Lake Athabaska. The boat was located two days later, swamped near the Narrows and Popular Point. A search was conducted and lasted for over one month without any success in locating M. Lidguerre and M. Sanger.

Case reference: 2014002936.CaseDesc: On February 3, 1988, David Ambroise, then 3 years old, was playing near the Saint-Maurice River in the First Nations reserve of Wemotaci. David approached too close to the water, slipped and fell in. He was then swept away by the current, and has never been found despite searches.

Case reference: 1986087920.CaseDesc: On July 30, 1985, Nicole Morin was seen for the last time leaving her apartment in Toronto, Ontario. Nicole had made arrangements to meet her friend in the lobby of their building so they could go swimming in the pool located at the rear of the building. Nicole never appeared in the lobby. Despite an intense search at the time, Nicole has not been found.

Mark: Forehead, Small birthmark on upper right side of forehead

Case reference: 2018043199.CaseDesc: In December of 1995, Myung Lim was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Myung and his wife had an argument and he told her he was returning to South Korea.

Case reference: 2014001690.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1971, James MacDonald departed Thompson, Manitoba in his "Money Mark 21" aircraft bound for Winnipeg. James never arrived. Despite intensive air search neither Mr. MacDonald nor his aircraft have been located.

Jewelry: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, engineering ring
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Calendar watch

Case reference: 2017055687.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2017, Ryan Mead was seen for the last time leaving his family residence in Brampton, Ontario to travel to British Columbia. Mr. Mead purchased camping equipment in Medicine Hat, Alberta in May of 2017. Some of his possessions were recovered along the South Saskatchewan River in late May.

Case reference: 2016068411.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1969, the body of a male, believed to be between the ages of 25 to 35 years old, was found on the Lake Erie Country Club beach, Malden Township, Essex County. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 150 lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was uncircumcised. It is estimated that he had been in the water for 5-7 days prior to discovery.

Teeth: He had an upper denture and he may have worn a lower denture.

Underwear: White, "Fruit of the Loom" brand, size 30

Case reference: 2014004742.CaseDesc: On January 9, 2006, Michael James Bosma left on foot from a care home located on Bernard Avenue in Kelowna, BC and failed to return.  Mr. Bosma had been diagnosed with schizophrenia and required essential medication.  ATM activity was recorded on his account during the night and early morning hours following his departure then all traces of him ceased.

Case reference: 2014001140.CaseDesc: On August 11, 1973, the skeletal remains of a male were discovered 30 miles south of Kashechewan and 60 miles west of Moosonee - 30 feet from a small creek that flows into James Bay. He is estimated to have been dead for 9-12 months.

Case reference: 2014004940.CaseDesc: On May 24, 2006, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Shemron King was seen for the last time by his father in Toronto, Ontario. When his father returned home, Shemrom and his mother were gone.

Case reference: 2014004734.CaseDesc: Roland Langlois went missing from the Malartic hospital on August 13, 1978. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2012020093.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2003, Garry Guenther, 58 years old, left his residence in the Hepburn district, SK. He was driving his white 1993 Ford F-150 truck with SK licence GGG. Mr. Guenther was reported to have been seen in Hoey, SK on the 23rd/ 24th of April, 2003, however, neither he nor his vehicle have been located.

Sweater: Cotton, Grey, sweat shirt with an image of a fish on the front

Deformity: Right Leg, bow-legged, walks with noticeable limp

Case reference: 2021030286.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2021 Mona Hu was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Mona had been in contact with her family in China, and was arranging to travel to see them.

Case reference: 2014004814.CaseDesc: Stephanie Stewart was employed as a Fire Spotter at the Athabasca Lookout near Hinton, Alberta when she disappeared on August 26, 2006. She was 70 years old at the time of her disappearance. Stephanie led an active lifestyle and was in good health. Her disappearance is being treated as suspicious. The police investigation is ongoing.

Case reference: 2015006607.CaseDesc: Peter Russell Yellowbird was reported missing by his family after they became concerned that he had been out of contact for so long. It is believed that Mr. Yellowbird’s last known location was in the Downtown area of Edmonton. Mr. Yellowbird’s disappearance is out of character, and as a result, there are concerns for his well-being. There are no indications to suggest foul play.

Case reference: 2012020137.CaseDesc: On Friday September 27, 1963, Diane Carrier went to the neighborhood park in the Old Quebec district of Quebec City, Quebec, to advise her brother to return home for dinner. Her brother came home alone and Diane has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003161.CaseDesc: On February 4, 1985, Andrew Pasztor was reported missing in Richmond, British Columbia.  Andrew had left home with the family vehicle which was later found at a restaurant in North Vancouver.  Andrew has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Beige, Vinyl with imitation fur collar

Case reference: 2006017699.CaseDesc: Marianne Minor was a resident of the St. Thomas Psychiatric Hospital in 1984. She left her ward to go to the canteen and has never been seen again.

Case reference: 2016006283.CaseDesc: Larry LEGACY was reported missing on March 22, 1993 when friends and family had not heard from him in several weeks. He was last known to reside in Edmonton, Alberta, but also frequented the Round Hill area, southeast of Edmonton. He also frequently traveled to Calgary, Alberta and to British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014006026.CaseDesc: Gilles Valcourt was last seen at the Canada Hotel in Waterloo, Quebec on December 29, 1974. His family has had no news since.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, A dagger and a cross

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004211.CaseDesc: On August 24, 1987, Louis Haineault, 48 years old, was last seen heading out in a boat to fish on Cree Lake, north of Buffalo Narrows, SK. Searchers located his boat and fishing nets, however the boat was inoperable. Searches of the area failed to locate Mr. Haineault.

Case reference: 2014005633.CaseDesc: On July 7, 2011, Dillon Mcmaster had been swimming in the Bow River in Alberta with a group of friends. Dillon was caught in a current, pulled under and was not seen again. Multiple efforts to locate Dillon were negative and he is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014005302.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2005, in Toronto, Canada, Zaina Trujillo-Talib was abducted by her father, Chaudhry Talib and her paternal grandmother, Shama Talib.  Chaudhry and Shama immediately took six-year-old Zaina to their family home located in Lahore, Pakistan.  Since this time, Zaina's mother has not been allowed to have any contact with her daughter.

Case reference: 2005004199.CaseDesc: On June 11, 1999, this male was found in Lake Ontario, approximately 8 miles north of Port Weller. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 156 lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He had likely been in the water for weeks to months.

Teeth: Natural teeth with restorations of his upper and lower posterior teeth.

Case reference: 2019040199.CaseDesc: In March 1966, the remains of a male believed to be between the ages of 50-60 were discovered by the CN Railway tracks in Chilliwack, British Columbia. The unidentified male had lost many of his teeth during life and had prominent eyebrows and a broken nose which was crooked to the right. It is believed he may have fallen or have been pushed from a moving train.

Teeth: Most of the teeth have been lost

Shoes: Black, Rubber soles, "Bilt-Rite Oil Proof", size 10, width E
Pants: Blue, With brown and white suspenders
Coat: Wool, Brown, Herringbone pattern, striped brown and light brown

Deformity: Nose, Nose crooked to the right due to an old injury

Case reference: 2014006333.CaseDesc: Deanne MacNeil was last seen on video surveillance at the Mundare Liquor Store during the early morning hours of November 28, 2013.

Case reference: 2020001488.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1988, Edward Parsons was seen for the last time as he was dragged from his apartment by a street gang in Toronto, Ontario. Edward was taken to a beach where he was violently assaulted, and buried in a shallow grave. The police were informed of this incident, and attended the grave. Upon their arrival, the alleged burial site was found empty.

Case reference: 2014006619.CaseDesc: On November 5, 2008, Colo Flannel was seen for the last time as he left the Intervalle Centre in the Longue-Pointe District in Montreal, Quebec. Colo suffers from a paranoid personality disorder, and may have possibly returned to Haiti.

Case reference: 2005001599.CaseDesc: Shawn Jones and Leslie Jones were seen on October 24, 1993. The two boys were hitchhiking from Cape Croker to Wiarton. They were dropped off in downtown Wiarton. Between October 26-28, 1993 Leslie Jones was seen with another male fitting the description of Shawn Jones. They were seen together at the Tim Hortons coffee shop in Owen Sound, Ontario. Shawn Jones was last seen on Berford Street in front of Pacific Hotel. Leslie Jones was last seen in front of the Tim Horton's restaurant on 9th East Street.

Case reference: 2014001045.CaseDesc: On October 18, 1976, the remains of a young adult male were found floating in the waters off Moresby Island, British Columbia. He was wearing jeans with a brown belt and had a long yellow rope tied around his waist.

Case reference: 2014003232.CaseDesc: Warren Grundy was reported missing from Edmonton, Alberta, in June 1983. Warren's personal identification and clothing were later found near the North Saskatchewan river bank below the High Level Bridge in Edmonton. Warren may have been sighted in Ontario two and a half years after he disappeared. There was also suggestion that he may have travelled to Ohio, USA.

Case reference: 2019016353.CaseDesc: On March 13th 2019 Michael Steele was seen for the last time at the Cape Breton Regional Hospital Emergency Department.

Case reference: 2015018154.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1966, Delores Whiteman was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2021037678.CaseDesc: On August 20, 2021, Vaughn Baumgardt was seen for the last time when he left a residence in Powell River, British Columbia. Vaughn has not been seen or heard from since.

Shoes: Black, Skater, Size 10, known to wear black DVS brand skater shoes

Case reference: 2020009598.CaseDesc: Angela Reid was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Angela had been visiting from Jamaica and was due to return on September 12, 1983, but she never boarded her flight.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2005002399.CaseDesc: On December 30, 1984, an unidentified Caucasian female was found in a ditch near Napanee, Ontario, approximately five kilometers south of the Village of Newburgh and four kilometers north of the Palace Road exit from Highway #401. She was estimated to have been there for 2-5 months.

Hair: Blonde, Dark blonde hair, shorter than collar with moderate curl

Case reference: 2013000042.CaseDesc: On August 8, 1999, Mary Smith was seen for the last time as she checked herself out of the Selkirk Mental Health Centre in Selkirk, Manitoba. Prior to her disappearance, Mary had received medical treatment, for head injuries, at the Health Sciences Center in Winnipeg. It is out of character for Mary, a mother of four, to not contact her family.

Tattoo: Right Hand, Flower- orchid or poinsettia

Case reference: 2014006235.CaseDesc: A lake freighter capsized in a violent storm on Lake Winnipeg, just north of Hecla Island, Manitoba. The vessel carried nine crew members and one passenger. There was only one survivor who managed to float on a piece of the wreckage to safety. All of the bodies of the remaining occupants were recovered with the exception of Allan Clemens and Tache Everett who were never located. Autopsies confirmed that the causes of death for those recovered were either drowning or death due to exposure in the cold water. Mr. Clemens and Mr. Everett are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014006028.CaseDesc: On January 18th, 2013, the Teton family checked into the New Otani Inn, located in Yokohama, Japan.  This was to be the final destination before returning to Canada.  While Henrik was in the shower, his wife Chieko and 1 year old son Takaya vanished. Henrik sought the assistance of police in Yokohama and the Canadian Embassy, to no avail. Shortly thereafter, Henrik attended 52 Division to report the incident and his subsequent attempt to locate his family. Toronto Police requested the assistance of Japanese police to confirm Chieko’s and Takaya’s well-being and Chieko’s intentions.  It was confirmed that both are in good health and that Chieko does not wish her whereabouts be disclosed.

Case reference: 2014005815.CaseDesc: On June 18, 2012 at 1630 hours, Regina Police Service received a phone call from Floyd Kakakaway reporting his brother Frederick Kakakaway missing. Floyd advised that the last time he saw Fred was early in the morning on the 14th of June, 2012 at 0600 hours. Fred told Floyd that he was headed to the Regent Park Safeway to look for cans. He hasn't returned home and no one has seen him since. Fred is a diabetic.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , A cross, forks and a heart
Left Upper Arm, Heart and ribbon with Fred
Deformity: Right Leg, Walks with a slight limp

Case reference: 2019030954.CaseDesc: On May 30, 2019, Tara Sculptor was seen for the last time by her mother on Carling Avenue in Ottawa, Ontario. It is possible that Tara took a bus from Ottawa to North Bay, Ontario.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, A bald spot on the back of the head

Scar: Forehead, Severe burns to the face
Right Leg, Skin graft removed from rear
Left Leg, Skin graft removed from rear
Back Of Head, Skin graft removed from behind

Case reference: 2014001757.CaseDesc: On January 12, 1987, Patricia Hutton was seen for the last time in the Saint-Léonard district of Montreal, Quebec. She had an appointment at a daycare center on the corner of Beaubien and Langelier for a job, but never attended. Patricia hasn’t been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020040144.CaseDesc: On May 28, 1950, Mabel Crumback was seen for the last time at approximately 12:30 am at her home located in Toronto, Ontario. Mabel had been babysitting her younger brother while her family was out of town. The following morning, she was gone.

Case reference: 2016052152.CaseDesc: On September 13, 2016 at approximately 9:30 p.m., John Casey was seen for the last time aboard a cruise vessel in transit between Cap-aux-Meules and Havre Saint-Pierre, Quebec. John has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004389.CaseDesc: On October 23, 2003, Bertha Melvin, who was residing in a group home, left a note advising she was going to the hospital; however she failed to show up.  Ms. Melvin is described a being very introverted and may have been frequenting the rural areas of Waterways in Fort McMurray, AB.

Case reference: 2014001524.CaseDesc: Matthew Leblanc was last seen by his sister on the morning of September 22, 1999, after he had coffee with her. Matthew was last observed at the bus stop located at the intersection of Superior/Menzies Street in Victoria. Matthew failed to attend an afternoon appointment and has not been heard or seen from since.

Case reference: 2014004487.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2003, at approximately 9:00 a.m. a fisherman and his helper, Phillip McKay, left Berens River Manitoba to retrieve their commercial fishing nets from Sandy Bar Bay. Upon arrival, one of the nets got caught in the propeller of the boat motor, pulling the boat down. Shortly thereafter, 2 large waves capsized the boat and both men were thrown into the water. Both men were wearing oilers, making it difficult to swim. The fisherman survived and was treated for shock and hypothermia. The body of his helper, Phillip McKay was never located.  Phillip McKay is presumed dead due to drowning.

Deformity: Right Leg, Crooked, walks with a limp

Case reference: 2014002539.CaseDesc: On August 28, 1973, Amelie McArthur’s vehicle was found running with the lights on and the driver’s side door open on the Taylor Bridge in Taylor, BC. Amelie was last seen leaving her home in Taylor in that vehicle earlier that morning.

Case reference: 2019052051.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2019, at approximately 4:00 am, Brandon Pollock was seen for the last time at his family residence in Hamilton, Ontario. That same morning, three men on a boat observed a man swimming in the area of the Lift Bridge in Lake Ontario. The men approached the swimmer, who was later identified as Brandon Pollock, to confirm his wellbeing. Brandon had told them that he was okay and advised them to pass by.

Mark: Right Side Of Neck, A brown birthmark on the right side of the neck, below the ear

Case reference: 1996004360.CaseDesc: Nina Akbarian may be in the company of her father, Naser Akbarian.

Case reference: 2020006473.CaseDesc: On April 22, 1967, at approximately 6:00pm, Roy Debone was last seen by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018038616.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2018, Cameron Richard Betker was reported missing by family.

Case reference: 1989125890.CaseDesc: Jeffrey was taken by a couple driving a 1979-80 blue chevy truck.

Case reference: 2013000041.CaseDesc: David Luborksy was reported missing on the 4th of November 2010. Mr. Luborksy was last seen leaving the Parklane Residence which is situated at 1095 Merivale Road, in the City of Ottawa.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Irishman holding a beer
Right Side Of Neck, Clover leaf

Case reference: 2008019999.CaseDesc: Patrick O’Connell has been missing since July 4, 2008. He was last seen by a friend and roommate. Patrick suffers from schizophrenia, substance abuse issues, and has previously made comments that he may harm himself.

Case reference: 2006011399.CaseDesc: Raymond Juranitch went hunting and fishing on the Ogoki Reservoir 80 km northeast of Armstrong, Ontario. He was last seen alone in a 16' aluminum canoe, powered by a 9.8 HP outboard motor. An extensive search of the area failed to locate Mr. Juranitch.

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede

Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2014005317.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1996, Sabrina John was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Sabrina’s parents had gotten into an argument that night, and the following day she and her mother had left their home with their clothing.

Case reference: 2008006298.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1996, Audrey Desjardins dropped her friend/co-worker at her residence in Welland after working a night shift.  Mrs. Desjardins was driving a red four-door 1985 Ford Crown Victoria.  The car was in excellent condition and there was a Canadian flag bumper sticker on the left rear bumper.

Boots: Black, running shoe styled work footwear
Jacket: Denim, Blue, Brown, 2 brown stripes on front going to shoulders, belte

Case reference: 2014021185.CaseDesc: Around 13:00 hours on July 6, 2005, Kim-Marie Kinsella was last seen in the area of 1695 Jane Street Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014016136.CaseDesc: Mr. Patel was last seen on July 2, 2014 in Montréal. Mr. Patel is diabetic, schizophenic and has a gambling problem. He left his residence saying to his wife, that he was going to the casino.

Case reference: 2014005145.CaseDesc: Sometime after July 30, 1939, Charles "Henry" Baxter went missing from the Hawarden District, SK. At the time of his disappearance, it was thought that Mr. Baxter went across the river to Tichfield to find work, or even joined the military and went overseas. However, Mr. Baxter was never seen again by his family, and these theories have never been substantiated.

Case reference: 2014003272.CaseDesc: On December 30, 1967 Michael Smith left his North Vancouver residence. Mr. Smith had been despondent over a friend’s death and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020134.CaseDesc: On the morning of September 4, 2002, Edward Taylor left his residence and took his vehicle to go to work. He has not been seen since. His car was found on September 7, 2002 in a service area of Porte-du-Nord, which is located on the Laurentides highway between Saint-Jérôme and Saint-Sauveur in Quebec.

Shirt: Dark Blue, Long sleeve shirt, navy blue

Case reference: 2014005346.CaseDesc: In August of 1987, Dale Sinclair was last seen as he left his home in Edmonton, Alberta, driving his wife’s vehicle. Dale had planned to cash a cheque at the bank, and then intended on visiting family in Gibbons, Alberta. On August 12, 1987, the vehicle he was driving was recovered by the police in Regina, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014004085.CaseDesc: On December 27, 1999, Simon Farah was seen for the last time at his residence in the Verdun District in Montreal, Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Simon was suffering from mental health issues. He has not been seen and has not given any news to his family, which is contrary to his habits.

Case reference: 2014002743.CaseDesc: On January 16, 1994, Yoann Crouzatier was reported missing after leaving the family residence in Laval, Quebec. Yoann has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Beige, Three-quarters with fur trimmed hood
Boots: Black, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Metal tips

Case reference: 2014003548.CaseDesc: On October 4, 1996, Billy Taylor was dropped off at a treatment facility in St. Norbert. Billy departed the centre in the evening prior to being processed. There have been a few reported sightings of Billy, however no one has had any contact with him since 1996. Billy Taylor's whereabouts remain unknown.

Jacket: Leather, Black, Canadian flag on back

Case reference: 2011000198.CaseDesc: On Wednesday, November 9, 2011 at approximately 11:15 a.m., Gordon Gibbs walked away from the Greater Niagara General Hospital, where he was a patient. About 30 minutes later a witness saw a man matching Mr. Gibbs's description looking over the railing into the hydro feeder canal in the area of Portage Rd. and Morrison St., Niagara Falls. Mr. Gibbs suffers from mental health issues and dementia.

Hair: White, Short, Receding hair;white beard, moustache and sideburns

Case reference: 2014006252.CaseDesc: On September 12, 2013, Meagan Rose Pilon was seen for the last time at her family home in Sudbury, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Meagan was living in the New Sudbury area. Police have not been able to rule out foul play in her disappearance.

Mark: Left Chest, Red birthmark on inner left breast

Case reference: 2020008363.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1981, at approximately 1:00pm, Dick Yeagar was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Dick had been evicted from his apartment on August 15, and did not show up to work the following day.

Case reference: 2014003304.CaseDesc: Milde was last seen in 1993 where his vehicle was abandoned near the City of Lethbridge Landfill. Footprints in the snow were seen leading from the vehicle into the coulees and disappeared.

Case reference: 2013000141.CaseDesc: Brandyn Dirienzo was last seen on the evening of October 4, 2006, entering an apartment building in Chilliwack, B.C. Brandyn was living a high risk lifestyle and foul play is heavily suspected. The police investigation into the disappearance of Brandyn is focussed on identifying those who have directly caused Brandyn's disappearance and/or death.  Investigators are looking for any information from anyone who has knowledge on the whereabouts of Brandyn. Brandyn is the father of two young children and his family is deeply affected by his disappearance.

Teeth: Crooked, Current photos seem to indicate a possible broken, upper right, front tooth

Jacket: Cotton, Black, Hooded Sweatshirt with "G-Unit" logo

Case reference: 2016018567.CaseDesc: Mekayla was last seen at the STC Bus Depot in Yorkton at 1:45 p.m. on April 12, 2016. She went to school in the morning, but left shortly after arriving. She went to several businesses in Yorkton throughout the morning, then returned to school around noon. She bought lunch at the restaurant in the bus depot, but did not get on a bus that day. Mekayla left the bus depot in the early afternoon and hasn't been seen since.

Case reference: 2012020052.CaseDesc: Marilyn Byskal went missing on June 20, 1974, while on a school organized canoe trip. She was last seen at her tent when everyone first woke up in the morning. Most present at the camp felt that Miss Byskal fell into the fast flowing waters of the Grass River, however no one witnessed this. An extensive 10 day water and ground search was conducted with negative results.

Case reference: 2014006137.CaseDesc: On January 2, 2012, Spencer Joly was last seen in Vernon BC. Spencer told a number of people he was travelling to the Kelowna Airport and eventually flying to Phuket Thailand. Spencer was seen later that same day being dropped off by Taxi in Predator Ridge, a new housing development in Vernon. There was no record of Spencer ever leaving the country or arriving in Thailand.

Case reference: 1999108210.CaseDesc: René Bessette was abducted when he was 8 years old by his father, Roger Bessette, leaving behind his mother and siblings.  His father's car was found abandoned later on the Victoria Bridge in Montreal.  The photos of René have been age-progressed to 40 years old.

Case reference: 2014003919.CaseDesc: On September 19, 2000, Ronald Montgomery went missing from his home in Calgary. He has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2016008385.CaseDesc: On December 18, 2015, Destiny Kazibwe was last seen at her school in Brampton.  It is believed that on February 18, 2016, Destiny's mother Rosemarie Tumusiime and father Robert Kazibwe, travelled from Brampton to Kabale, Uganda with their twin children Destiny and Adam.  Further investigation has not been able to confirm the well-being of Destiny or of her brother Adam.

Case reference: 2006010999.CaseDesc: It is believed that Sander Lingman became lost while staking claims near Gripp Lake, 69 kilometres north west of Nakina, Ontario. They were unable to find Mr Lingman, despite intensive searches of the area.

Case reference: 2014005604.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2011, Dorothy Thomas was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to being reported missing, Dorothy had not returned home for eighteen days.

Case reference: 2012020111.CaseDesc: On July 15 2010, James Daniel Khan left the family home for a walk and never returned. He suffers from mental health problems and he left without his medication.

Case reference: 2012020056.CaseDesc: Sylvia Ann Guiboche was last seen around mid June 2003.  Sylvia is known to frequent the Sargent Avenue/Ellice Avenue area of Winnipeg, Manitoba.  Sylvia is at high risk of being exploited.

Other: Abdomen, Was 6-9 months pregnant at time of disappearance

Case reference: 2014006135.CaseDesc: In December 2012, Victor Pedtchenko was last seen in the area of 55 Triller Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. Victor had not been seen for one month before being reported missing.
